data.title: Smooth Scrolling not working with scroll-wheel (Windows 10)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.17.0 (be377c0faf7574a59f84940f593a6849f12e4de7, 2017-10-04T23:45:46.804Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
- Extensions: none

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. set "editor.smoothScrolling": true
2. close and re-open VS Code
3. try scrolling the editor - it will jump as if "editor.smoothScrolling" were set to False

Reproduces without extensions: Yes (tried to launch with _code --disable-extensions_, same issue)

To be honest I don't know whether this is an issue related to this specific version as it's the first time I'm using VS Code.

My mouse is an MX Master and I'm using an ASUS N550 laptop.
Anybody else experiencing this issue?

Thanks

data.title: Git - fix  `there are no changes to stash` message issue
data.body: Show `there are no changes to stash` message only if neither staged nor unstaged files are present (#35645)

data.title: indents after multiline comment incorrect
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.16.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create a multiline comment
2. hit enter twice. The first line after the comment is indented properly. the second enter indents to the indent level of the comment, which is usually incorrect.

example:
```
/*
 *
 *
 */
first enter leaves me here

/*
 *
 *
 */

 hit enter twice, and it indents me here, underneath the asterisk, which is off by a space.
```
Ideally, if I'm not actively typing in a multiline comment, I would want auto-indent to completely ignore comments altogether as if they're not even there.

Hope this bug is fixed really soon!

data.title: Insiders deb repo package broken (Web download works)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: code-insiders (1.18.0-1507267008) [amd64]
- OS Version: ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1. apt install code-insiders
(dpkg: error processing archive /var/cache/apt/archives/code-insiders_1.18.0-1507267008_amd64.deb (--unpack):
 cannot copy extracted data for './usr/share/code-insiders/resources/app/node_modules/vscode-ripgrep/bin/rg' to '/usr/share/code-insiders/resources/app/node_modules/vscode-ripgrep/bin/rg.dpkg-new': unexpected end of file or stream)

Works for the download from the webpage: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/

sha1sum: 64f7cdb98ba110a642099112c270cba246a9e16d apt-download code-insiders
sha1sum: 9e80c77e805ab1a2a57367270de5c58b2cc02387 code-insiders_1.18.0-1507267008_amd64.deb

The files have same size but differ. A huge chunk in the broken file is filled with zeros :+1:

Reproduces without extensions: N/A

data.title: Import hints not working for Javascript files
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.17.0
- OS Version: Arch Linux

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a JS project with empty `jsconfig.json`
2. Create a `test.js` with following content:
```
export default class Test {}
```
3. Create a `test2.js` with following content:
```
class Test2 extends Test {}
```

Actual behavior:
- No lightbulb with hint to `import Test from './test` appear.

Correct behavior
- Lightbulb with hint to `import Test from './test` appear, just like for `.ts` files.

It works fine once I change extensions from `.js` to `.ts`.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.17.0 (be377c0faf7574a59f84940f593a6849f12e4de7, 2017-10-04T23:45:46.804Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 6.1.7601
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
language-x86-64-assembly|13x|2.2.11
rainbow-brackets|2gu|0.0.6
read-only-indicator|ale|0.6.0
alignment|ann|0.3.0
Doxygen|bbe|1.0.0
python|don|0.7.0
matlab|Gim|0.7.1
triggertaskonsave|Gru|0.1.3
vscode-dimmer|hoo|2.1.0
mediawiki|jak|2.1.0
vscode-clang|mit|0.2.2
select-part-of-word|mle|1.0.1
cpptools|ms-|0.13.1
PowerShell|ms-|1.4.3
indent-rainbow|ode|0.6.1
vscode-clearcase|Ope|1.10.0
vscode-icons|rob|7.14.0
indenticator|Sir|0.4.2
vscode-hexdump|sle|1.4.0
code-spell-checker|str|1.4.6
comment-snippets|Tob|0.2.0
selectline-statusbar|tom|0.0.2
change-case|wma|1.0.0
highlight-trailing-white-spaces|yba|0.0.2

(1 theme extensions excluded)


---

Steps to Reproduce:

0. Two folders containing different copies of the same source code, e.g. for working on different branches.
1. Open a file in one workspace.
2. Switch workspaces.
3. Open the same filename in the new workspace.
4. Often the file from the first workspace appears at the top of the list, so it very easy to open the file from the other workspace.

Is there anyway to prevent as I have often edited the wrong file? I would like to exclude files from other workspaces. This could be done a wildcard or only allowing files inside the current root folder. However, restricting to the current root folder would prevent quick opening of files outside the workspace, which also I often do.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes/No

data.title: Request textDocument/rangeFormatting failed when pasting inside script tags
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.17.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create html file with  **<script type="text/html"></script>** element
2. Paste any text inside the script tags
3. (The problem) - Output window in being opened (Html Language server) with following error:
`[Error - 11:49:13] Request textDocument/rangeFormatting failed.
  Message: Request textDocument/rangeFormatting failed with message: Cannot read property 'getId' of undefined
  Code: -32603 `

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: No

data.title: feature request: improvement to auto suggestions in html documents

- VSCode Version: 1.170
- OS Version: Windows 10


Auto suggestions is the best way to improve productivity but I found that VScode doesn't provide suggestions for some things like suggesting default parameters to select.

For Example, If I use 
`<link rel="" href="">`
It would be better if when placing the cursor inside "", a suggestion like stylesheet appears.

data.title: Cannot click and drag to select portion of selected text
data.body:
Editor doesn't respond when trying to select a portion of some previously selected text via click and dragging, clearing the selection then click and dragging works as you would imagine. I would expect the selection to be cleared on mouse down.

Checked with `--disable-extensions` and default user settings.

Cheers!

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.17.0
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.6 (16G29)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Select text
2. Click and drag a portion of within the selection

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

### VSCode
![vscode-selection](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2156395/31269988-7981b9f6-aa7a-11e7-921d-b4aad54fa858.gif)

---|---|---

vscode-generate-getter-setter|DSK|0.4.2

vscode-pandoc|Dou|0.0.8
EditorConfig|Edi|0.10.1
latex-workshop|Jam|3.5.5
vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.18
latex-preview|ajs|0.5.1
vscode-intelephense-client|bme|0.7.2
vscode-eslint|dba|1.3.2
githistory|don|0.2.3
gitlens|eam|5.4.1
tslint|eg2|1.0.9
git-project-manager|fel|1.4.0
php-debug|fel|1.11.1
php-intellisense|fel|1.5.1
php-pack|fel|1.0.1
auto-rename-tag|for|0.0.14
ruby|gro|0.0.6
phpcs|ika|0.7.0
codeacejumper|luc|1.1.5
Go|luk|0.6.66
ruby-symbols|mig|0.1.5
vscode-clang|mit|0.2.2
cpptools|ms-|0.13.1
php-docblocker|nei|1.3.0
advanced-new-file|pat|0.5.0
java|red|0.11.0
vscode-table-formatter|shu|1.2.1
vscode-hexdump|sle|1.4.0
Align|ste|0.2.0
rewrap|stk|1.5.1
gotimeformat|v4r|1.0.1
vscode-todo-highlight|way|0.5.11

---

In an external terminal window, typing `cmd+K` clears all text. The default keyboard shortcuts contain the following, indicating that this should work in the integrated terminal too:

```
{ "key": "cmd+k",                 "command": "workbench.action.terminal.clear",
                                     "when": "terminalFocus" },
```

Steps to Reproduce:

1. In the Terminal pane, type `cmd+K` to clear the text.
2. Instead of clearing, the status line displays "Waiting for second key of chord".

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: XMLs code folding problem
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.17.0 (be377c0faf7574a59f84940f593a6849f12e4de7, 2017-10-04T23:45:46.804Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.14393
- Extensions: Extensions are disabled
---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open an XML with multiple nested elements, e.g.:
```
<body>
<section>
<sectionBody>
blahblahblahblah
</sectionBody>
</section>
</body>
```

2. Fold the parent element of a series of nested elements, e.g. the <body>. This results to:
```
<body>...
blahblahblahblah
</sectionBody>
</section>
</body>
```

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes
